text.section:
General courts-martial may be convened by:
The Governor;
The adjutant general; or
A general officer who is designated as a commander.

If any such commanding officer is an accuser, the court shall be convened by superior competent authority and may in any case be convened by such superior competent authority if considered desirable by that authority.

law.history: Amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 32, sec. 24, effective June 25, 2013. -- Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 20, effective July 1, 1954.
